result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Salas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
01-27-16/ Judge Jeffrey Kremers
Correction of clerical error on 11-09-15 Sentencing entry:
Counts 1 and 6 are to run consecutive to each other
AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Huber/release privileges for work, child care and, if eligible, the Court will allow release privileges for the Day Reporting Center, with credit for 3 days.  Defendant to report in by 11-16-15

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
CONCURRENT AS TO BOTH COUNTS
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 03/18/2016 @ 1:30pm, Br-36

miscConds.notes: ALL COUNTS: Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered; to be paid during period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.

- No contact with firearms. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order. Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
- Complete Batterer's Intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No Contact with victim unless approved by the court. The No Contact Order may be modified to No Violent Contact after the defendant signs up for his batterer's treatment, with the approval of the agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Pay supervision fees.

cab
NO FILE IN COURT.
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas Salas in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
 Sentencing proceeds.    Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification. 
Statements by counsel and defendant. 

As to count 6:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 1 month at the House of Correction with Huber/release privileges for work, child care and, if eligible, the court will allow release privileges for the Day Reporting Center, with credit for 3 days.  Defendant to report in to serve his sentence by 11/16/2015.
.
As to count 1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 4 months at the House of Correction with Huber/release privileges for work, child care and, if eligible, the court will allow release privileges for the Day Reporting Center, with credit for 3 days. Defendant to report in to serve his sentence by 11/16/2015.
.
As to counts 2 and 7:
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months as to each count in the House of Correction with credit for -0- days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years, concurrent,  with the following conditions:
- Serve 45 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review, as to count 2.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.  The no contact order may be modified to no violent contact after the defendant signs up for his batterer's treatment, with the approval of the agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
 
Received and filed: 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  
Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Deefendant Nicholas Salas appeared in court with Attorney Daniel Meylink. Dax Odom appeared on behalf of the state of Wisconsin.
cab
Case was calendared for a trial today.
Defendant wants to change his plea.
As to counts 1, 2, 6 and 7:
 Defendant waived  rights and pled guilty.
Guilty Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights and Elements of Criminal Offenses - Felonies received and filed.
Defendant examined as to his plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Judgment of Conviction entered.
As to counts 3, 4 and 5:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered counts 3, 4 and 5 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.
.
Case adjourned for sentencing.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Nicholas Salas in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Justice Point report received and filed.
The witnesses were not subpoenaed for the jury trial today.
Court grants the state's request.  Case adjourned for another jury trial date in Branch 36.
  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
to adjourn from the State received and filed.

Defendant Nicholas Salas in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 36 at 08/17/2015 at 8:30am.  State rescinded their offer. Case adjourned to Branch 36.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Final pre-trial on August 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas Salas NOT in court, appearance waived, with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called at request of branch 36. Case set for Final Pretrial on 8/11/2015. Branch 36 not in session that date. Court vacated the Final Pretrial date and reset matter for Final Pretrial before branch 36.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point
State's motion for modification of bail heard.  Court will not raise bail at this time.  Same previous conditions of bail to continue.

Defendant Nicholas Salas in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Amended Complaint received and filed.  Defense waives reading of Amended Complaint and enters a plea of not guilty.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Motions to be filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Signed and filed, No Contact/NO FIREARMS Order.  Defendant to have no contact with NILDA A. AND THE TOOL BOX.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Nicholas Salas in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Nicholas Salas in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
